title: Introduction to didTEnets
text: didTEnets package implements Transfer Entropy-informed Difference--Differences (TE-) framework policy evaluation interconnected systems. methodology combines network analysis causal inference measure policy effects financial contagion systemic risk transmission.

title: Introduction to didTEnets
text: Traditional difference--differences () approaches often use simple outcome variables like stock returns volatility, fail capture complex dynamics systemic risk transmission interconnected financial markets. TE-framework addresses limitation : Network-Informed Outcomes: Using Network-Informed Contagion Index (NICI) instead simple returns Directed Information Flow: Measuring transfer entropy quantify directional risk transmission Policy Spillovers: Accounting spillover effects Network-Informed Policy Intensity (NIPI) Crisis Analysis: Focusing extreme events quantile conditioning

title: Introduction to didTEnets
text: Transfer entropy measures directed flow information time series, quantifying much knowing past series X reduces uncertainty future series Y, beyond already know Y‚Äôs past.

title: Introduction to didTEnets
text: NICI serves outcome variable TE-models. measures weighted sum incoming transfer entropy flows country, representing much systemic risk country absorbing network neighbors.

title: Introduction to didTEnets
text: NIPI serves treatment variable, combining direct policy effects spillover effects neighboring countries network.

title: Introduction to didTEnets
text: can install development version didTEnets GitHub:
code: # Install devtools if you haven't already install.packages("devtools")  # Install didTEnets devtools::install_github("username/didTEnets") library(didTEnets) #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'quantmod': #>   method            from #>   as.zoo.data.frame zoo library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

title: Introduction to didTEnets
text: ‚Äôs basic example using package‚Äôs sample data:
code: # Load sample data data(sample_financial_returns) data(sample_policy_data)  # Quick analysis with built-in sample data tickers <- c("^GSPC" = "USA", "^FTSE" = "GBR", "^GDAXI" = "DEU",               "^FCHI" = "FRA", "^N225" = "JPN", "^AXJO" = "AUS")  # Run complete TE-DiD analysis results <- run_complete_tedid_analysis(   tickers = tickers,   start_date = "2019-01-01",   end_date = "2021-12-31",   create_plots = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE )  # View main results summary(results$tedid$main_model)

title: Introduction to didTEnets
code: # Define financial market tickers tickers <- c("^GSPC" = "USA", "^FTSE" = "GBR", "^GDAXI" = "DEU")  # Download financial data financial_data <- download_financial_data(tickers, "2019-01-01", "2021-12-31")

title: Introduction to didTEnets
code: # Create realistic policy data policy_data <- create_policy_data(financial_data$countries, "2019-01-01", "2021-12-31")

title: Introduction to didTEnets
code: # Calculate different types of network weights network_weights <- calculate_network_weights(financial_data$returns)

title: Introduction to didTEnets
code: # Define periods for analysis crisis_start <- as.Date("2020-03-01") crisis_end <- as.Date("2020-12-31")  period_breaks <- list(   "Pre_Crisis" = which(index(financial_data$returns) < crisis_start),   "Crisis" = which(index(financial_data$returns) >= crisis_start &                    index(financial_data$returns) <= crisis_end),   "Post_Crisis" = which(index(financial_data$returns) > crisis_end) )  # Calculate TE matrices te_matrices <- calculate_te_matrices_by_period(financial_data$returns, period_breaks)

title: Introduction to didTEnets
code: # Calculate outcome variable (NICI) nici_data <- calculate_nici(te_matrices, network_weights)  # Prepare monthly policy data monthly_policy <- policy_data %>%   mutate(year_month = format(Date, "%Y-%m")) %>%   group_by(CountryCode, year_month) %>%   summarise(StringencyIndex = mean(StringencyIndex, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")  # Calculate treatment variable (NIPI) nipi_data <- calculate_nipi(monthly_policy, network_weights)

title: Introduction to didTEnets
code: # Prepare dataset for TE-DiD estimation tedid_dataset <- prepare_tedid_dataset(nici_data, nipi_data, treatment_groups)  # Estimate TE-DiD model tedid_model <- estimate_tedid_model(tedid_dataset)  # Extract and interpret results results <- extract_tedid_results(tedid_model, tedid_dataset)

title: Introduction to didTEnets
code: # Create network comparison plots network_plots <- create_network_comparison(te_matrices)  # Create TE-DiD result visualizations tedid_plots <- visualize_tedid_results(tedid_dataset)  # Display plots print(tedid_plots$timeseries) print(tedid_plots$difference)

title: Introduction to didTEnets
text: key output TE-analysis interaction coefficient Œ≤‚ÇÅ model: IncomingFlow_{} = Œ≤‚ÇÄ + Œ≤‚ÇÅ ¬∑ EarlyAdopter_i √ó CrisisPeriod_t + Œ±_i + Œ≥_t + Œµ_{} : - Œ≤‚ÇÅ < 0: Early policy adoption reduced incoming financial contagion - Œ≤‚ÇÅ > 0: Early policy adoption increased incoming financial contagion (possibly due uncertainty) - Œ≤‚ÇÅ ‚âà 0: significant policy effect

title: Introduction to didTEnets
text: Network-Aware: Captures interconnectedness spillover effects Crisis-Focused: Uses quantile conditioning focus extreme events Directional: Measures directed information flows rather simple correlations Policy-Relevant: Provides clear implications crisis management

title: Network Analysis with didTEnets
text: vignette demonstrates network analysis capabilities didTEnets package, focusing transfer entropy calculation, network weight construction, network evolution visualization.
code: library(didTEnets) #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'quantmod': #>   method            from #>   as.zoo.data.frame zoo library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(igraph) #>  #> Attaching package: 'igraph' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:dplyr': #>  #>     as_data_frame, groups, union #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     decompose, spectrum #> The following object is masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     union library(ggraph)

title: Network Analysis with didTEnets
text: Transfer entropy (TE) model-free measure directed information flow time series. Unlike correlation, symmetric, transfer entropy captures direction information flow.

previous_headings: Network Analysis with didTEnets > Understanding Transfer Entropy
title: Network Analysis with didTEnets
text: enhanced transfer entropy function didTEnets includes several innovations: Quantile Conditioning: Focus extreme events (crisis periods) Volatility Scaling: Incorporate market volatility realistic magnitudes Robust Handling: Deal missing data insufficient observations
code: # Generate sample data with known relationship set.seed(123) n <- 200 source <- rnorm(n) target <- 0.3 * source + rnorm(n, 0, 0.8)  # target influenced by source  # Calculate transfer entropy in both directions te_source_to_target <- calculate_enhanced_transfer_entropy(source, target) te_target_to_source <- calculate_enhanced_transfer_entropy(target, source)  cat("TE from source to target:", round(te_source_to_target, 4), "\n") cat("TE from target to source:", round(te_target_to_source, 4), "\n")

previous_headings: Network Analysis with didTEnets > Understanding Transfer Entropy
title: Network Analysis with didTEnets
code: # Example with crisis periods set.seed(456) n <- 300 normal_period <- rnorm(200, 0, 1) crisis_period <- rnorm(100, -2, 2)  # More volatile, negative bias source_series <- c(normal_period, crisis_period) target_series <- c(rnorm(200, 0, 1), 0.6 * crisis_period + rnorm(100, 0, 0.5))  # Calculate TE focusing on crisis events (bottom 10% quantile) te_crisis <- calculate_enhanced_transfer_entropy(source_series, target_series,                                                 quantile_threshold = 0.1)  # Calculate TE focusing on normal periods (50th percentile) te_normal <- calculate_enhanced_transfer_entropy(source_series, target_series,                                                 quantile_threshold = 0.5)  cat("TE during crisis events:", round(te_crisis, 4), "\n") cat("TE during normal periods:", round(te_normal, 4), "\n")

title: Network Analysis with didTEnets
text: Network weights determine policy spillovers contagion effects propagate financial system. didTEnets package supports multiple weight types:

previous_headings: Network Analysis with didTEnets > Network Weight Construction
title: Network Analysis with didTEnets
text: Correlation-based weights capture co-movement patterns markets. Higher correlations indicate stronger connections.
code: # Using sample data data(sample_financial_returns)  # Calculate correlation-based weights cor_weights <- calculate_network_weights(sample_financial_returns, "correlation")  # Examine the weight matrix print(round(cor_weights$correlation, 3))

previous_headings: Network Analysis with didTEnets > Network Weight Construction
title: Network Analysis with didTEnets
text: Geographic weights assume countries region stronger connections due trade, cultural, institutional similarities.
code: # Calculate geographic weights with custom regions custom_regions <- list(   europe = c("GBR", "DEU", "FRA"),   asia_pacific = c("JPN", "AUS"),   americas = c("USA") )  geo_weights <- calculate_network_weights(sample_financial_returns, "geographic",                                        geographic_groups = custom_regions)  print(round(geo_weights$geographic, 3))

previous_headings: Network Analysis with didTEnets > Network Weight Construction
title: Network Analysis with didTEnets
text: Economic similarity weights use market volatility patterns proxy economic development level market maturity.
code: # Calculate economic similarity weights (based on volatility patterns) econ_weights <- calculate_network_weights(sample_financial_returns, "economic")  print(round(econ_weights$economic, 3))

previous_headings: Network Analysis with didTEnets > Network Weight Construction
title: Network Analysis with didTEnets
code: # Calculate all weight types and create composite all_weights <- calculate_network_weights(sample_financial_returns)  # The composite weights combine multiple sources of information print(round(all_weights$composite, 3))

title: Network Analysis with didTEnets
text: network analysis, calculate transfer entropy pairs countries different time periods market conditions: matrix shows directed information flows countries: - Rows: Source countries (information senders) - Columns: Target countries (information receivers) - Values: Transfer entropy strength
code: # Define analysis periods returns_data <- sample_financial_returns n_obs <- nrow(returns_data)  period_breaks <- list(   "Pre_Crisis" = 1:floor(n_obs * 0.4),   "Crisis" = floor(n_obs * 0.4):floor(n_obs * 0.7),   "Post_Crisis" = floor(n_obs * 0.7):n_obs )  # Calculate TE matrices for different periods and quantiles te_matrices <- calculate_te_matrices_by_period(returns_data, period_breaks,                                               quantiles = c(0.1, 0.5, 0.9))  # Examine the structure names(te_matrices)

previous_headings: Network Analysis with didTEnets > Network Statistics and Evolution
title: Network Analysis with didTEnets
text: Key network statistics include: - Density: Proportion possible connections exist - Transitivity: Clustering coefficient (‚ÜíB‚ÜíC implies ‚ÜíC) - Average Strength: Mean TE flow strength - Max TE: Strongest individual connection
code: # Calculate comprehensive network statistics network_stats <- calculate_network_statistics(te_matrices)  # View summary statistics print(network_stats)

previous_headings: Network Analysis with didTEnets > Network Statistics and Evolution
title: Network Analysis with didTEnets
code:
# Analyze network evolution to establish contagion crisis_stats <- network_stats %>%   filter(Quantile == "Q0.1") %>%  # Focus on crisis quantile   arrange(Period)  if (nrow(crisis_stats) >= 2) {   pre_crisis <- crisis_stats[crisis_stats$Period == "Pre_Crisis", ]   crisis <- crisis_stats[crisis_stats$Period == "Crisis", ]      if (nrow(pre_crisis) > 0 && nrow(crisis) > 0) {     density_change <- crisis$Density - pre_crisis$Density     mean_te_change <- crisis$Mean_TE - pre_crisis$Mean_TE          cat("Network density change:", round(density_change, 4), "
")     cat("Mean TE change:", round(mean_te_change, 4), "
")          if (density_change > 0.05 || mean_te_change > 0.01) {       cat("‚úì CONTAGION ESTABLISHED
")     } else {       cat("‚óã Limited evidence of contagion
")     }   } }

previous_headings: Network Analysis with didTEnets > Network Visualization
title: Network Analysis with didTEnets
code: # Create custom network plot create_custom_network_plot <- function(te_matrix, title = "Financial Network") {   # Convert to igraph object   g <- graph_from_adjacency_matrix(te_matrix, mode = "directed",                                    weighted = TRUE, diag = FALSE)      # Set node attributes   V(g)$size <- degree(g, mode = "in") * 5 + 10   V(g)$color <- case_when(     V(g)$name %in% c("USA", "GBR") ~ "red",     V(g)$name %in% c("DEU", "FRA") ~ "blue",     TRUE ~ "orange"   )      # Create plot   ggraph(g, layout = "stress") +     geom_edge_arc(aes(width = weight, alpha = weight),                  arrow = arrow(length = unit(2, "mm")),                  color = "gray50") +     geom_node_point(aes(size = size, color = color), alpha = 0.8) +     geom_node_text(aes(label = name), repel = TRUE, fontface = "bold") +     scale_edge_width_continuous(range = c(0.5, 2), guide = "none") +     scale_edge_alpha_continuous(range = c(0.3, 0.8), guide = "none") +     scale_size_continuous(range = c(5, 15), guide = "none") +     scale_color_identity() +     labs(title = title) +     theme_void() }  # Apply to crisis period matrix if ("Crisis_Q0.1" %in% names(te_matrices)) {   crisis_plot <- create_custom_network_plot(te_matrices$Crisis_Q0.1,                                             "Crisis Period Network")   print(crisis_plot) }

previous_headings: Network Analysis with didTEnets > Advanced Network Analysis
title: Network Analysis with didTEnets
code: # Calculate network centrality measures calculate_centrality_measures <- function(te_matrix) {   g <- graph_from_adjacency_matrix(te_matrix, mode = "directed",                                    weighted = TRUE, diag = FALSE)      centrality_df <- data.frame(     Country = V(g)$name,     InDegree = degree(g, mode = "in"),     OutDegree = degree(g, mode = "out"),     InStrength = strength(g, mode = "in"),     OutStrength = strength(g, mode = "out"),     Betweenness = betweenness(g),     PageRank = page_rank(g)$vector   )      return(centrality_df) }  # Apply to crisis matrix if ("Crisis_Q0.1" %in% names(te_matrices)) {   centrality_measures <- calculate_centrality_measures(te_matrices$Crisis_Q0.1)   print(centrality_measures) }

previous_headings: Network Analysis with didTEnets > Advanced Network Analysis
title: Network Analysis with didTEnets
code: # Analyze which connections persist across periods analyze_network_persistence <- function(te_matrices, threshold = 0.05) {   # Get crisis period matrices   crisis_matrices <- te_matrices[grep("Q0.1", names(te_matrices))]      # Binarize matrices based on threshold   binary_matrices <- lapply(crisis_matrices, function(x) {     (x > threshold) * 1   })      # Calculate persistence (connections present in all periods)   if (length(binary_matrices) >= 2) {     persistence_matrix <- Reduce("+", binary_matrices) / length(binary_matrices)          # Find highly persistent connections (present in >75% of periods)     persistent_connections <- which(persistence_matrix > 0.75, arr.ind = TRUE)          if (nrow(persistent_connections) > 0) {       cat("Highly persistent connections:\n")       for (i in 1:nrow(persistent_connections)) {         from <- rownames(persistence_matrix)[persistent_connections[i, 1]]         to <- colnames(persistence_matrix)[persistent_connections[i, 2]]         cat(paste(from, "‚Üí", to), "\n")       }     }   } }  # Analyze persistence analyze_network_persistence(te_matrices)

title: Network Analysis with didTEnets
text: Ensure sufficient observations reliable TE estimation (minimum 30-50 per period) Handle missing data appropriately Check structural breaks data

previous_headings: Network Analysis with didTEnets > Best Practices
title: Network Analysis with didTEnets
text: Choose quantile thresholds based research question (0.1 crisis, 0.5 normal) Set appropriate TE thresholds network visualization (typically 0.01-0.05) Consider lag structure TE calculation

previous_headings: Network Analysis with didTEnets > Best Practices
title: Network Analysis with didTEnets
text: Remember TE measures information flow, causation Consider economic mechanisms behind network connections Validate results known financial relationships

previous_headings: Network Analysis with didTEnets > Best Practices

title: didTEnets - Transfer Entropy-informed Difference-in-Differences
text: Transfer Entropy-Informed Difference--Differences Network Analysis didTEnets package implements Transfer Entropy-informed Difference--Differences (TE-) framework policy evaluation interconnected systems. methodology combines network analysis causal inference measure policy effects financial contagion systemic risk transmission.

title: didTEnets - Transfer Entropy-informed Difference-in-Differences
text: Traditional difference--differences approaches often fail capture complex dynamics systemic risk transmission interconnected financial markets. TE-framework addresses : üåê Network-Informed Outcomes: Using directed information flows instead simple returns üìä Crisis-Focused Analysis: Quantile conditioning focus extreme events üîÑ Policy Spillovers: Accounting spillover effects network weights üìà Comprehensive Visualization: Network evolution policy effect plots

title: didTEnets - Transfer Entropy-informed Difference-in-Differences
text: Transfer Entropy Calculation: Enhanced TE quantile conditioning crisis analysis Network Weight Construction: Multiple weight types (correlation, geographic, economic, composite) NICI Construction: Network-Informed Contagion Index sophisticated outcome variable NIPI Construction: Network-Informed Policy Intensity spillover effects TE-Estimation: Robust econometric models two-way fixed effects Network Visualization: Comprehensive plots network evolution policy effects

title: didTEnets - Transfer Entropy-informed Difference-in-Differences
text: can install development version didTEnets GitHub:
code: # Install devtools if you haven't already install.packages("devtools")  # Install didTEnets devtools::install_github("username/didTEnets")

title: didTEnets - Transfer Entropy-informed Difference-in-Differences
code: library(didTEnets)  # Define financial markets for analysis tickers <- c("^GSPC" = "USA", "^FTSE" = "GBR", "^GDAXI" = "DEU",               "^FCHI" = "FRA", "^N225" = "JPN", "^AXJO" = "AUS")  # Run complete TE-DiD analysis results <- run_complete_tedid_analysis(   tickers = tickers,   start_date = "2019-01-01",   end_date = "2021-12-31",   create_plots = TRUE )  # View main results summary(results$tedid$main_model) print(results$summary)  # Access visualizations if (!is.null(results$plots)) {   print(results$plots$tedid_plots$timeseries)   print(results$plots$network_comparison$Crisis) }

title: didTEnets - Transfer Entropy-informed Difference-in-Differences
text: TE-framework implements following equation: IncomingFlow_{} = Œ≤‚ÇÄ + Œ≤‚ÇÅ ¬∑ EarlyAdopter_i √ó CrisisPeriod_t + Œ±_i + Œ≥_t + Œµ_{} : - IncomingFlow_{}: Network-Informed Contagion Index (NICI) - outcome variable - EarlyAdopter_i: Treatment group indicator (early vs.¬†late policy adopters) - CrisisPeriod_t: Crisis period indicator - Œ≤‚ÇÅ: Key coefficient measuring policy effect financial contagion - Œ±_i: Country fixed effects - Œ≥_t: Time fixed effects

title: didTEnets - Transfer Entropy-informed Difference-in-Differences
code: # Sample model results #                            Estimate Std. Error t-value Pr(>|t|)   # EarlyAdopter:CrisisPeriod -0.0052    0.0021    -2.476   0.014 *  # Interpretation: Early adoption of stringent policies REDUCED  # incoming financial contagion by 0.52% during the crisis period

title: didTEnets - Transfer Entropy-informed Difference-in-Differences
code: # 1. Data Acquisition financial_data <- download_financial_data(tickers, "2019-01-01", "2021-12-31") policy_data <- create_policy_data(financial_data$countries, "2019-01-01", "2021-12-31")  # 2. Network Analysis   network_weights <- calculate_network_weights(financial_data$returns) te_matrices <- calculate_te_matrices_by_period(financial_data$returns, period_breaks)  # 3. Variable Construction nici_data <- calculate_nici(te_matrices, network_weights) nipi_data <- calculate_nipi(monthly_policy, network_weights)  # 4. TE-DiD Estimation tedid_dataset <- prepare_tedid_dataset(nici_data, nipi_data, treatment_groups) tedid_model <- estimate_tedid_model(tedid_dataset)  # 5. Visualization network_plots <- create_network_comparison(te_matrices) tedid_plots <- visualize_tedid_results(tedid_dataset)

title: Calculate Enhanced Transfer Entropy ‚Äî calculate_enhanced_transfer_entropy
text: Computes transfer entropy two time series quantile conditioning crisis period analysis. core function measuring directed information flow TE-framework.

title: Calculate Enhanced Transfer Entropy ‚Äî calculate_enhanced_transfer_entropy
code: calculate_enhanced_transfer_entropy(   source,   target,   quantile_threshold = 0.1,   lag = 1,   min_observations = 30 )

title: Calculate Enhanced Transfer Entropy ‚Äî calculate_enhanced_transfer_entropy
text: source Numeric vector time series (source variable) target Numeric vector time series (target variable) quantile_threshold Numeric value 0 1 quantile conditioning lag Integer lag transfer entropy calculation (default = 1) min_observations Minimum number observations required

title: Calculate Enhanced Transfer Entropy ‚Äî calculate_enhanced_transfer_entropy
text: Numeric value representing transfer entropy source target

title: Calculate Network Weights ‚Äî calculate_network_weights
text: Computes various types network weights use network-informed analysis. Supports correlation-based, geographic, economic similarity, composite weights.

title: Calculate Network Weights ‚Äî calculate_network_weights
code: calculate_network_weights(   returns_data,   weight_types = c("correlation", "geographic", "economic", "composite"),   geographic_groups = NULL )

title: Calculate Network Weights ‚Äî calculate_network_weights
text: returns_data xts object matrix financial returns weight_types Character vector specifying weights calculate Options: "correlation", "geographic", "economic", "composite" geographic_groups Optional named list defining geographic regions

title: Calculate Network Weights ‚Äî calculate_network_weights
text: Named list containing different weight matrices

title: Calculate Network Weights ‚Äî calculate_network_weights
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Calculate all weight types weights <- calculate_network_weights(returns_data)  # Calculate only correlation weights cor_weights <- calculate_network_weights(returns_data, "correlation") } # }

title: Calculate Network-Informed Contagion Index (NICI) ‚Äî calculate_nici
text: Computes Network-Informed Contagion Index, measures degree market absorbing systemic risk network neighbors. serves outcome variable TE-framework.

title: Calculate Network-Informed Contagion Index (NICI) ‚Äî calculate_nici
code: calculate_nici(   te_matrices,   weight_matrices,   monthly_dates = NULL,   crisis_start = as.Date("2020-03-01"),   crisis_end = as.Date("2020-12-31") )

title: Calculate Network-Informed Contagion Index (NICI) ‚Äî calculate_nici
text: te_matrices Named list transfer entropy matrices weight_matrices Named list network weight matrices monthly_dates Vector dates time-varying analysis crisis_start Date crisis period begins crisis_end Date crisis period ends

title: Calculate Network-Informed Contagion Index (NICI) ‚Äî calculate_nici
text: Named list containing NICI results weight type

title: Calculate Network-Informed Contagion Index (NICI) ‚Äî calculate_nici
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ monthly_dates <- seq(as.Date("2019-01-01"), as.Date("2021-12-31"), by = "month") nici_data <- calculate_nici(te_matrices, weight_matrices, monthly_dates) } # }

title: Calculate Network-Informed Policy Intensity (NIPI) ‚Äî calculate_nipi
text: Computes Network-Informed Policy Intensity, measures direct policy effects plus spillover effects neighboring countries network. serves treatment variable TE-framework.

title: Calculate Network-Informed Policy Intensity (NIPI) ‚Äî calculate_nipi
code: calculate_nipi(   monthly_policy,   weight_matrices,   spillover_param = 0.4,   monthly_dates = NULL,   crisis_start = as.Date("2020-03-01"),   crisis_end = as.Date("2020-12-31") )

title: Calculate Network-Informed Policy Intensity (NIPI) ‚Äî calculate_nipi
text: monthly_policy data.frame policy data (CountryCode, year_month, StringencyIndex) weight_matrices Named list network weight matrices spillover_param Numeric parameter controlling spillover intensity (default = 0.4) monthly_dates Vector dates analysis crisis_start Date crisis period begins (time-varying spillovers) crisis_end Date crisis period ends

title: Calculate Network-Informed Policy Intensity (NIPI) ‚Äî calculate_nipi
text: Named list containing NIPI results weight type

title: Calculate Network-Informed Policy Intensity (NIPI) ‚Äî calculate_nipi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Prepare monthly policy data monthly_policy <- policy_data %>%   mutate(year_month = format(Date, "%Y-%m")) %>%   group_by(CountryCode, year_month) %>%   summarise(StringencyIndex = mean(StringencyIndex, na.rm = TRUE))    nipi_data <- calculate_nipi(monthly_policy, weight_matrices) } # }

title: Calculate Transfer Entropy Matrices by Period ‚Äî calculate_te_matrices_by_period
text: returns_data xts object financial returns data period_breaks Named list defining time period indices quantiles Numeric vector quantile thresholds analyze lag Integer lag TE calculation

title: Calculate Transfer Entropy Matrices by Period ‚Äî calculate_te_matrices_by_period
text: Named list transfer entropy matrices period-quantile combination

title: Calculate Transfer Entropy Matrices by Period ‚Äî calculate_te_matrices_by_period
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Define periods period_breaks <- list(   "Pre_Crisis" = 1:100,   "Crisis" = 101:200,   "Post_Crisis" = 201:300 ) te_matrices <- calculate_te_matrices_by_period(returns_data, period_breaks) } # }

what: didTEnets: Transfer Entropy-Informed Difference-in-Differences for Network Analysis ‚Äî didTEnets-package
title: didTEnets: Transfer Entropy-Informed Difference-in-Differences for Network Analysis ‚Äî didTEnets-package
text: didTEnets package implements Transfer Entropy-informed Difference--Differences (TE-) framework policy evaluation interconnected systems. methodology combines network analysis causal inference measure policy effects financial contagion systemic risk transmission.

title: didTEnets: Transfer Entropy-Informed Difference-in-Differences for Network Analysis ‚Äî didTEnets-package
text: Network-based contagion analysis using transfer entropy Policy impact assessment spillover effects Financial network visualization evolution analysis Robust difference--differences estimation two-way fixed effects Comprehensive crisis period analysis tools

title: didTEnets: Transfer Entropy-Informed Difference-in-Differences for Network Analysis ‚Äî didTEnets-package
text: run_complete_tedid_analysis: Complete analysis pipeline download_financial_data: Financial data acquisition calculate_enhanced_transfer_entropy: Transfer entropy calculation calculate_network_weights: Network weight construction calculate_nici: Network-Informed Contagion Index calculate_nipi: Network-Informed Policy Intensity estimate_tedid_model: TE-model estimation create_network_comparison: Network visualization

title: didTEnets: Transfer Entropy-Informed Difference-in-Differences for Network Analysis ‚Äî didTEnets-package
text: TE-framework addresses limitations traditional policy evaluation : Using network-informed outcome variables instead simple returns Measuring directed information flows transfer entropy Accounting policy spillover effects network weights Analyzing crisis contagion quantile conditioning Providing comprehensive network evolution visualization

title: didTEnets: Transfer Entropy-Informed Difference-in-Differences for Network Analysis ‚Äî didTEnets-package
text: Define financial market tickers analysis period Download financial data create policy measures Calculate network weights transfer entropy matrices Construct NICI (outcome) NIPI (treatment) variables Estimate TE-models appropriate controls Visualize network evolution policy effects Interpret results policy recommendations

title: didTEnets: Transfer Entropy-Informed Difference-in-Differences for Network Analysis ‚Äî didTEnets-package
text: Schreiber, T. (2000). Measuring information transfer. Physical Review Letters, 85(2), 461. Angrist, J. D., & Pischke, J. S. (2009). Mostly harmless econometrics: empiricist's companion. Princeton University Press.

title: didTEnets: Transfer Entropy-Informed Difference-in-Differences for Network Analysis ‚Äî didTEnets-package
text: Claude AI claude@anthropic.com Avisek Banerjee avisek@example.com

title: didTEnets: Transfer Entropy-Informed Difference-in-Differences for Network Analysis ‚Äî didTEnets-package
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Quick start example library(didTEnets)  # Define markets for analysis tickers <- c("^GSPC" = "USA", "^FTSE" = "GBR", "^GDAXI" = "DEU")  # Run complete analysis results <- run_complete_tedid_analysis(   tickers = tickers,   start_date = "2019-01-01",   end_date = "2021-12-31",   create_plots = TRUE )  # View main results summary(results$tedid$main_model) print(results$summary)  # Access visualizations if (!is.null(results$plots)) {   print(results$plots$tedid_plots$timeseries) } } # }

text: tickers Named character vector names Yahoo Finance tickers values country codes (e.g., c("^GSPC" = "USA", "^FTSE" = "GBR")) start_date Character string "YYYY-MM-DD" format start date end_date Character string "YYYY-MM-DD" format end date min_observations Minimum number observations required per market

title: Download Financial Data for TE-DiD Analysis ‚Äî download_financial_data
text: List containing: prices xts object adjusted closing prices returns xts object log returns (percentage) countries Character vector country codes summary List data summary statistics

title: Estimate TE-DiD Model ‚Äî estimate_tedid_model
text: Estimates Transfer Entropy-informed Difference--Differences model using panel data methods two-way fixed effects.

title: Estimate TE-DiD Model ‚Äî estimate_tedid_model
code: estimate_tedid_model(   tedid_dataset,   formula = "IncomingFlow ~ EarlyAdopter * CrisisPeriod",   method = "plm",   robust = FALSE )

title: Estimate TE-DiD Model ‚Äî estimate_tedid_model
text: tedid_dataset data.frame prepared prepare_tedid_dataset() formula Character string formula object model specification method Character string specifying estimation method ("plm" "lm") robust Logical indicating whether use robust standard errors

title: Estimate TE-DiD Model ‚Äî estimate_tedid_model
text: Model object (plm lm) estimation results

title: Estimate TE-DiD Model ‚Äî estimate_tedid_model
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Basic TE-DiD model model1 <- estimate_tedid_model(tedid_dataset)  # Enhanced model with controls model2 <- estimate_tedid_model(tedid_dataset,    formula = "IncomingFlow ~ EarlyAdopter * CrisisPeriod + AvgStringency") } # }

title: Extract TE-DiD Results ‚Äî extract_tedid_results
text: Extracts formats key results TE-model estimation, including treatment effects, standard errors, economic interpretation.

title: Extract TE-DiD Results ‚Äî extract_tedid_results
code: extract_tedid_results(   model,   tedid_dataset = NULL,   interaction_terms = c("EarlyAdopter:CrisisPeriod") )

title: Extract TE-DiD Results ‚Äî extract_tedid_results
text: model Model object estimate_tedid_model() tedid_dataset Original dataset used estimation interaction_terms Character vector interaction terms extract

title: Extract TE-DiD Results ‚Äî extract_tedid_results
text: Named list model results interpretation

title: Extract TE-DiD Results ‚Äî extract_tedid_results
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ model <- estimate_tedid_model(tedid_dataset) results <- extract_tedid_results(model, tedid_dataset) print(results$summary) } # }

title: Prepare TE-DiD Dataset ‚Äî prepare_tedid_dataset
text: Prepares dataset Transfer Entropy-informed Difference--Differences estimation combining NICI outcomes, NIPI treatments, policy data.

title: Prepare TE-DiD Dataset ‚Äî prepare_tedid_dataset
code: prepare_tedid_dataset(   nici_data,   nipi_data,   treatment_groups = NULL,   policy_data = NULL,   weight_type = "composite",   crisis_start = as.Date("2020-03-01"),   scale_nici = 1000 )

title: Prepare TE-DiD Dataset ‚Äî prepare_tedid_dataset
text: nici_data Named list NICI results calculate_nici() nipi_data Named list NIPI results calculate_nipi() treatment_groups data.frame treatment group assignments policy_data data.frame additional policy controls weight_type Character string specifying weight type use crisis_start Date crisis period begins scale_nici Numeric scaling factor NICI (better estimation)

title: Prepare TE-DiD Dataset ‚Äî prepare_tedid_dataset
text: data.frame ready TE-estimation

title: Prepare TE-DiD Dataset ‚Äî prepare_tedid_dataset
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Prepare treatment groups treatment_groups <- data.frame(   CountryCode = c("USA", "GBR", "DEU"),   Group = c("LateAdopter", "LateAdopter", "EarlyAdopter"),   TreatmentDummy = c(0, 0, 1) )  tedid_dataset <- prepare_tedid_dataset(nici_data, nipi_data, treatment_groups) } # }

title: Run Complete TE-DiD Analysis ‚Äî run_complete_tedid_analysis
text: Executes complete Transfer Entropy-informed Difference--Differences analysis pipeline data acquisition model estimation visualization. main wrapper function didTEnets package.

title: Run Complete TE-DiD Analysis ‚Äî run_complete_tedid_analysis
code: run_complete_tedid_analysis(   tickers = c(`^GSPC` = "USA", `^FTSE` = "GBR", `^GDAXI` = "DEU", `^FCHI` = "FRA",     `^N225` = "JPN", `^AXJO` = "AUS"),   start_date = "2019-01-01",   end_date = "2021-12-31",   crisis_start = as.Date("2020-03-01"),   crisis_end = as.Date("2020-12-31"),   stringency_threshold = 70,   weight_types = c("correlation", "geographic", "composite"),   quantiles = c(0.1, 0.5, 0.9),   create_plots = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Run Complete TE-DiD Analysis ‚Äî run_complete_tedid_analysis
text: tickers Named character vector financial market tickers start_date Character string analysis start date ("YYYY-MM-DD") end_date Character string analysis end date ("YYYY-MM-DD") crisis_start Date crisis period begins crisis_end Date crisis period ends stringency_threshold Numeric threshold policy treatment classification weight_types Character vector network weight types calculate quantiles Numeric vector quantile thresholds TE analysis create_plots Logical indicating whether generate visualizations verbose Logical indicating whether print progress messages

title: Run Complete TE-DiD Analysis ‚Äî run_complete_tedid_analysis
text: Named list containing analysis results: data Financial policy data networks Network weights TE matrices tedid TE-model results plots Visualization objects (create_plots = TRUE) summary Analysis summary statistics

title: Run Complete TE-DiD Analysis ‚Äî run_complete_tedid_analysis
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Define financial markets tickers <- c("^GSPC" = "USA", "^FTSE" = "GBR", "^GDAXI" = "DEU",               "^FCHI" = "FRA", "^N225" = "JPN", "^AXJO" = "AUS")  # Run complete analysis results <- run_complete_tedid_analysis(   tickers = tickers,   start_date = "2019-01-01",   end_date = "2021-12-31",   create_plots = TRUE )  # View main results print(results$tedid$main_model) print(results$summary) } # }

title: Sample Policy Data ‚Äî sample_policy_data
text: data frame 6,570 observations 3 variables: CountryCode Character. ISO3 country codes (USA, GBR, DEU, FRA, JPN, AUS) Date Date. Daily dates 2019-01-01 2021-12-31 StringencyIndex Numeric. Policy stringency index (0-100 scale)

title: Sample Policy Data ‚Äî sample_policy_data
text: synthetic dataset reflects realistic COVID-19 policy response patterns, including early adopters (faster policy implementation) late adopters (slower policy response). data can used demonstrate policy evaluation using TE-framework. Policy patterns include: Early adopters: AUS, DEU (March 1-8, 2020) Moderate adopters: FRA, JPN (March 10-15, 2020) Late adopters: GBR, USA (March 18-22, 2020)
